description.raw:
Allow parent of IntermediateDevice to be None. This is useful for devices that can operate in static or buffered mode depending on instantiation settings.

Use case: some DAQmx devices have only static outputs, and even those that
have buffered outputs can be operated in static mode without a clock. It doesn't make
a lot of sense to change what type of class they are based on how they are
configured (e.g. with instantiation arguments), so I figure the least odd thing
to do is just extend IntermediateDevice's definition into devices that *might*
be clocked, but don't necessarily have to be.

Not 100% sure if it's related, but also have the t0 property return zero when an output doesn't have a pseudoclock. This prevents an error when calling go_high() on a static digital out for example, the underlying implementation of which sets an instruction at t=0 which comes with error checking that it isn't before t0 for that device.

This prevents an error when calling go_high() on a static digital out for example, the underlying implementation of which sets an instruction at t=0 which comes with error checking that it isn't before t0 for that device.
